stream_context.summary: Kaze prototypes and debugs several new features for Return to Yoshi’s Island: a dynamic health-bar HUD, a falling/long-jump squash-and-stretch animation, and—most of the stream—an N64-friendly "cement pit" where Mario’s footsteps permanently stamp into the ground. He also brainstorms NPC and colour changes for the Oil-Rig/Construction level and removes the planned cosmetic-skins system in favour of a coin-shop economy.

development_findings.summary: Working HUD: a new health bar starts centred, slides to top-middle, then returns to centre when damage is taken. Speed still being tuned.
development_findings.quote: Movement is a bit slow—maybe at least two times as fast. Yeah, I can easily do that.

development_findings.summary: Squash-and-stretch jump: Mario’s head and model now squash on take-off; idea originated with community member ZorroOrganic.
development_findings.quote: When Mario falls see how his head moves? ZorroOrganic had this idea a while ago.

development_findings.summary: Skins feature cut. Coins will instead purchase house upgrades, minigames, or a purchasable Power Star that grants double jump & invincibility.
development_findings.quote: We used to think that we want skins—skins are gone. Maybe you’ll be able to buy a Power Star for a hundred coins so the most difficult stars are easy to get.

development_findings.summary: Temple level declared "colour vomit"; bricks shifted from grey to brown/gold; new water texture shared in Discord for future pass.
development_findings.quote: Something about this level is just ass—colours make no sense… maybe change the bricks to brown? That already looks better.

development_findings.summary: Oil-Rig NPC plan: worker Koopas & Goombas with hard-hats, shielded Thwomps, glass-carrying Koopas, crane-mounted Thwomp, angry Wiggler foreman whose colour changes as player causes chaos.
development_findings.quote: Every time you mess with them he’s just gonna get more and more red.

development_findings.summary: Cement pit footprint system implemented via render-to-texture instead of spawning geometry; 4×3 pixel decal repeated onto a 127×63 texture; memory-corruption bounds checks added; ultimately switched to circular prints to avoid rotation math.
development_findings.quote: We can make it circular so I don’t have to write an image-rotation algorithm—no one cry about this, please.

development_findings.summary: Technical constraints: large-texture mode on real N64 is finicky; footprint decals limited to ~100 tris if geometry method used; EEPROM size too small to store persistent data, hence render-to-texture outweighs geometry.
development_findings.quote: We don’t have that much EEPROM size… this way we don’t have a limit on the footprints either.

development_findings.summary: Future demo: considering a second demo limited to the first three levels with all improvements; not planning a larger demo.
development_findings.quote: Any thoughts for a second demo? It’d be fun to release the original three levels again… I’m not gonna make a banger demo than that.

development_findings.summary: Firm stance against using the PC port; prefers staying on native N64 or would jump straight to Unreal if targeting PC only.
development_findings.quote: If I wanted my game PC-only with nicer graphics I’d just use Unreal Engine, not the PC port.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: if watching someone play is "painful," he lowers difficulty (e.g., falling in sea will remove only 1 HP after seeing Zeina struggle).
context_findings.quote: My bar is: when I watch a player and it’s painful, I need to make it easier.

context_findings.summary: Frustration with Twitch & VS Code; believes Twitch is "going down" and spends on-stream time fighting editor autocompletion bugs.
context_findings.quote: Twitch has made the decision to squeeze out the last bit of money before it burns down.

context_findings.summary: Personal life: planning to leave stream to visit Zeina’s parents at 5:30; casual banter about food (first Dairy Queen, hates coffee).
Opinionated gamer: openly dislikes Yoshi’s Island DS and Mario World style games, calls them "terrible."
context_findings.quote: Yoshi’s Island DS is the worst—an actual insult to Yoshi.

biobak.summary: Provided new health-bar HUD art and real-time feedback on its speed and placement.
biobak.quote: Movement is a bit slow—you could make it at least two times as fast.

biobak.summary: Discussed temple colour palette; suggested centring HUD and agreed brown bricks look more "Mario."

zeina.summary: Play-testing influenced design; her repeated deaths in the sea prompted Kaze to reduce penalty to 1 HP.
zeina.quote: I watched Zeina play it—she would have had to restart 15 times.

zeina.summary: Creates animations (currently Bowser pout) and offered to draw dive & ground-pound footprint textures.
zeina.quote: Do you want to make one for Mario ground-pounding? Yeah, I can certainly try.

zeina.summary: Appears in stream as partner; coordinate off-stream family visit; casual banter.

key_stories.title: The Cement Footprint Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze wanted a construction-site cement pit where Mario’s steps leave permanent marks. Initial geometry decals risked memory overflow, rotation math, and performance drops. He pivoted to render-to-texture, downsized to 4×3 pixel stamps, built bounds-checking, and finally chose circular prints to dodge rotation code.
key_stories.challenge: Create performant, persistent footprints on real N64 hardware without exhausting memory or CPU.
key_stories.process: Tested geometry decals ➜ considered fading limits ➜ discovered render-to-texture path ➜ wrestled large-texture tool errors ➜ hand-coded blending & bounds ➜ simplified to circular stamps.
key_stories.outcome: Fully functional cement pit with unlimited footprints, foundation for additional effects (dives, slides); will add angry Wiggler overseer next.
key_stories.key_quote: This way we don’t have a limit on the footprints—render-to-texture wins.

key_stories.title: Cutting Skins, Adding a Coin Shop
key_stories.summary: Cosmetic skins were originally planned, but Kaze scrapped them mid-stream. Coins will now unlock house decorations, minigames, or even a purchasable Power Star power-up, altering game balance.
key_stories.challenge: Provide optional rewards for coin collection that feel meaningful.
key_stories.process: Discussed with chat; weighed complexity of multiple skins; brainstormed shop items.
key_stories.outcome: Skins removed; design pivot toward upgradable hub and purchasable assists.
key_stories.key_quote: Skins are gone—instead maybe you can buy a Power Star for a hundred coins.

key_stories.title: Temple Palette Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Kaze reviewed an ancient-temple level and found the grey bricks ugly. With Biobak, he live-tinted bricks to brown/gold and saved a new water texture.
key_stories.challenge: Level art felt like "colour vomit" and clashed with Yoshi aesthetic.
key_stories.process: Live texture recolour; assessed sky-water harmony; gathered references like El Dorado.
key_stories.outcome: Agreed new palette direction; Biobak will later remodel with approved colours.
key_stories.key_quote: Something about this level is just ass—the colours make no sense.
